algorithm_technique: Union-Find to group equal variables, then check inequalities
Graph coloring (BFS/DFS) to detect contradictions in inequalities
problem_summary_simple: Determine if variable assignments can satisfy given equality and inequality equations.
problem_summary_technical: Use Union-Find for equalities, then verify inequalities against connected components.
key_insights: Union-Find is ideal for managing equivalence classes.
Process equalities first to establish groups, then check inequalities.
Path compression and union by rank optimize Union-Find.
Model equations as a graph where edges represent equality.
Use graph traversal (like BFS/DFS) to find connected components (groups of equal variables).
Check if any inequality violates these established groups.
